##Anxious to get back to Beijing, he tried to broadcast live from his rented room

WMSYGSDR

Functional introduction, each line has a serious person, even ordinary people have extraordinary stories. Huazhong University of Science and Technology Press Official non-fiction story platform, the story of the people will meet here.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
“

- story of the AGES.-YEAH

"I don't want to be miserable for comfort, but I'm not as miserable as them, at least I'm miserable for life and they're miserable for survival, " Zhang Xian said later, as if relieved.

”

“

- story of the AGES.-YEAH

"I don't want to be miserable for comfort, but I'm not as miserable as them, at least I'm miserable for life and they're miserable for survival, " Zhang Xian said later, as if relieved.

- story of the AGES.-YEAH

"I don't want to be miserable for comfort, but I'm not as miserable as them, at least I'm miserable for life and they're miserable for survival, " Zhang Xian said later, as if relieved.

”

Story exercise

Title 62

1

In the small rental room, Zhang Xian lay limp on the bed. The air, which had not been cleaned for a month, seemed to be slightly musty. Suddenly, he felt the dust in his eyes, rubbing the corners of his eyes and subconsciously shaking his nose to sniff, only to find that his face was covered with a thin mask.

This is Zhang Xian returned to Beijing to resume isolation during the most common state. Before this, he had always thought of himself as a restless person, but now it seems that only the back and forth on the screen index finger is still showing the waves of the heart.

As the "old North Drift" , Zhang Xian in Beijing ups and downs for many years, floating is not high, sinking is sunk to the bottom of the water. When he first came to Beijing 10 years ago, he was just a cub. At first he was cheated to do promotion, then he did marketing, and then he made a small profit from doing business in Taobao shops by the east wind of e-commerce, he bought a house in his hometown of Baoding, Hebei Province.

In recent years, with the rise of live broadcasting and the ebb of E-commerce, he could not keep up with the Times. He had to stop his business because his income was poor. He went to a company to help a publishing house do some printing work. His salary was not high, but he was idle, "I don't know, I'm old enough to support my family. I'm 33, I have a wife and kids. "

In January, Zhang did not remember whether he returned home on the 17th or 18th, he remembers coming home in shock -- "Your father was beaten and couldn't keep his eyes open, " his mother sobbed as she called from her daughter-in-law's home in the same village.

His father was afraid that Zhang would go home to seek revenge and would not go to the doctor until he got home. Father has been suffering from facial paralysis, Zhang first took him to the hospital after examination, it was found that the injury aggravated the condition leading to the left eyelid closed on. During those two days in the hospital, he looked at his old and distressed father and made up his mind to give him a better life.

Due to the news block, until 21 to accompany his father was taken out of the hospital temperature, Zhang did not know the news of the epidemic. Since then, the epidemic has spread rapidly, with Internet and television news reports popping up and surrounding villages closing down, with only Zhang Xian's village remaining behind. It is said that Kobayashi, the son of the old Lin family, came back from Wuhan. His wife bought many things from him. "close contact" made the family worried. They happened to see her killing chickens, he thinks even chickens carry the plague.

On the second day of the Lunar New Year, the village was finally sealed up. During that time, the number of new confirmed cases reported on the news each day was exploding, and Zhang Xian sat in the doorway, watching his phone as he puffed away at his cigarette, his butt exploding on the concrete floor of the doorway. At first it was said that the incubation period was about a week. By the fourth day of the eighth lunar month, everyone in the family was quite normal. Before Zhang Xian could breathe a sigh of relief, he found that the incubation period had been extended again.

The incubation period is constantly lengthening and the resumption of work is also constantly delayed.

The company was not strict about the February 10 deadline for Beijing to resume work, but many of its colleagues returned to Beijing early on or around the 10th. Family advised Zhang not to return to Beijing, in fact, his own heart is very uneasy, but in the end it was rare to start a fire, the family members were scolded again, finally questioned: "I do not go back, who support the family? "

The family was silent, but puzzled. Zhang Xian did not tell his family that he had heard similar stories from within his own company about the layoffs that many small and medium sized businesses are planning to make in order to keep the money flowing in the Sleeper Cell.

Layoffs are a hurdle that businesses and Zhang Xian don't want to face, but have to.

2

Home is a north-south path, about five or six miles south of the place is a pond. One of Zhang Xian's favorite things to do every day after setting a delay,
Is to walk from home to the pond, and then not stop to go home. If only, he thought, the road back to Beijing could be as easy to follow as this one.

On the morning of Feb. 13, Zhang Xian made his last trip to the pond and hitched a ride with his neighbor, the old Chens, to Beijing. The highway is empty, with few cars, like most city streets. On the way, they passed a service area where they wanted to resupply, but there was no food, no merchandise, only car repair and two employees on duty.

Zhang Xian's rental house is a self-built apartment building near Fengbo Station, Shunyi District. The facilities and everything were terrible, but it was cheaper, 700 yuan a month. Zhang works near Wangjing, where many struggling locals live in Fengbo, because subway line 15 doesn't have to be switched to the end. At the end of the day, the subway from Wangjing Station to Fengbo takes five or six trains to squeeze in.

"those returning to Beijing should register in the duty room and isolate themselves for 14 days. Those who fail to register and refuse to accept home observation, centralized observation and other preventive and control measures shall be investigated for responsibility according to law. At the end of the 14-day quarantine, go to the duty office with an inch of photo to get a pass, zhang stared at the landlord handed his notice repeatedly looked several times, some confused.

"Just be happy, you'll be a day late, you'll have to apply for the apartment, which is a lot of trouble, " Zhang said, glumly, as his longtime landlord advised him. After February 14, people returning to Beijing were not allowed to check into their apartments without permission and had to apply to the district government. With the rest of his colleagues back at work, and with 14 more days of isolation, so many fewer than the others, he couldn't figure out how to get himself off the list.

For a moment, Zhang Xian felt the mask on his face become a piece of tape, blocking his nose and mouth, and the air began to fill up again. Smoking, it seems, has become a crime. There was no place to cook in the surrounding houses, and to order takeout you had to go to the front door of the apartment and walk to the side of the road, quite a distance, one hundred meters. Zhang Xian chose the nearest supermarket, a few miles away, to buy a case of instant noodles and three bottles of bottled water.

It took him nearly an hour to get back to his apartment, gasping for air with supplies. The moment he opened the door, the air was so thick that the dust came flying out of the room. After a few unconscious hand flicks, he turns and closes the door, collapsing head first on the bed.

3

Shortly before noon the next day, Zhang Xian got up,
If you are hungry, you will eat instant noodles. If you are tired, you will lie on the bed and close your eyes. If you are tired, you will lose the clear concept of night and day.

This is the first week of Zhang Xian's real life during the isolation period, all day without sunlight, with the surrounding dust, do not want to do anything, cycle.

On the seventh night of the quarantine, his wife made a video call. Zhang, who was awakened, quickly took off his mask and wiped his face to make himself look less decadent. When the call came through, he realized that the son on the screen was the one he wanted to see. He looked fatter and his cheeks were plump.

He couldn't help laughing and asked his son, "how can you be my mother? "

"I don't know, mom is down there, I commandeered the mobile phone, " the son replied, holding his chin.

Zhang Xian remembered that his son had been carefully separated from the rest of the family and was in the same situation as himself, but then he pulled a long face and asked, "what are you doing at home without school? Don't just play games. "

"No, I don't. I have class on my cell phone every day, I have to do homework, and I can't go out and play. But my mother gives me an hour a day to play games. Don't you think it's nice that I set aside some time to look for you, Dad? " The son began to scowl, as he spoke, his eyes began to smile.

"There's a good little boy. Come and give daddy a kiss... " after the call was cut off, Zhang Xian straightened his aching upper body and pondered for a long time. He suddenly felt that his son was doing better at such a young age than he was, and he suddenly felt an urge to do something.

From the beginning of the eighth day of isolation, he has nothing to look at Li Jiaqi with goods video, to see if you can figure out the live with goods tips, can the closed for a long time Taobao shop to come out. He did not know the original men can also wear lipstick, Li Jiaqi's live style let him extremely uncomfortable, but I heard that this is the most popular with cargo anchor, he or one after another to see the end.

"In my dreams it was him, in my dreams it was Omg  , you young people should know that catchphrase, and I dreamed I put lipstick on my hands, " Zhang Xian said, stroking his head with a wry smile and thinning hair.

In addition to researching the live stream, Zhang Xian downloaded a part time APP in hopes of finding an online part time job. Because his normal job involves editing and typesetting content, Zhang Xian was hoping to find a similar part time job. He saw the daily junction 300 typing part time job, and finally found that it was a swindler who pulled people into the group to pay a deposit of 100 yuan, normally vigilant, he handed it over like he'd been brainwashed.

"Once bitten, twice shy" was Zhang Xian's mantra, but this time he wasn't "scared" any more. After that, he saw a number of similar part-time jobs, and after a bit of hesitation, he clicked on them, turns out they were all posted by the same scam artist.

He was not afraid of disappointment, but of hopelessness.

The only thing that works is a part-time job called "trial online, " where you get paid for downloading an application for three minutes, but you usually have to wait five or six minutes to get the job done. Zhang used an IPHONE 6 he bought a few years ago, which has very little memory and is now very much a card. It usually takes 10 minutes or more to complete a task, download it and finish the trial, but the pay is only a few cents. At the end of the day, Zhang Xian's gross income was in the mid 20s, and before he could console himself with the thought that he was somehow worth the cost of a meal, he was hit by a wave of pain from his cervical vertebrae.

When I video chat with him to do an interview, his picture will always turn to black. When I asked, he replied, a little awkwardly, "I went back to the APP to see if there were any suitable part-time jobs available. " He added, "I'm not in a hurry. I'm just bored, mostly. "

Zhang had never thought his boredom to ease is to begin with a "visit. ". According to the regulations, people in quarantine with the apartment is not allowed to visit. At first he did not care, because the Weekday apartment workers are in a hurry, each other does not interfere. Living in the opposite door is a 20-year-old Guy Ah Hui, a head of yellow hair plus a partial, playing earrings also tattoo a big flower arm. Zhang Xian had always despised him, and when he happened to pass by on his way home with a cigarette hanging out of his mouth, he couldn't help but pick up his pace.

A Hui is a hairdresser in a Beijing barbershop. He is the lowest class of hairdresser. In plain words, he is half an apprentice. The exterior is just a rendering of the general environment, but inside he is a very shy person. To Zhang Xian's surprise, the barbershop also cut staff, and Ah Hui knew he had been fired before he returned to Beijing. In the face of Zhang Xian's doubt, AH Hui's voice came through the door: "early return, can also find a new job early. Although the number of unemployed, but perhaps the epidemic has passed, and to recruit people? "

Ah-hui thought that since he couldn't do anything during the isolation period, it would be better to play video games. It didn't seem to be affected at all. It wasn't like a bei-piao who had no savings and lost his job. Zhang compared himself, feeling quite a lot, perhaps this is the difference between young and middle-aged people.

When he got home and lay down, Zhang Xian, still a little anxious, would often look at Li Jiaqi and part time software, but his mood had calmed down a lot. He has also made video calls with many friends, most of whom are like him who have returned to Beijing to quarantine, and many of whom are his colleagues. There are people like him who want to find a new way out, people who want to practice an instrument, and people who want to cook for fun. With the virus raging, life in quarantine seems to be more colorful than ever.

It was as if everyone was more relaxed than Zhang, and as if everyone was just like Zhang Xian.

4

Time flies. The rest of the week will soon be over. On February 26th, the last day of the quarantine, there was still no firm news of layoffs, Taobao stores had no idea how to make money from mobile phones, and The Big One was in bed texting me in the morning, "It feels like all of this is piling up on top of him and he's out of breath. "

I didn't know how to comfort him, but in the afternoon he suddenly sent me a link. It opened up on the Internet and exposed relevant videos of stranded people living in underground parking lots in Wuhan. They had homes they couldn't go back to, no money, no shelter, not even food.

That day, Zhang did not see Li Jiaqi live video, no longer looking for the "mobile phone fortune" bubble, he thought of a Hui, other games he can not play, he downloaded a lot of small games played all afternoon. "It feels like it's something you do and hold when you're young, " he said. "It's like you're really young and you don't have so many worries. "

By 9 p.m. , Zhang Xian was ready for bed, thinking he might finally stop dreaming about her.

When the quarantine expired on the 27th, Zhang got up early and opened all the windows. The air was so clear that he was pleasantly surprised. After washing and dressing properly, he put on a new face mask and put a leather bag under his arm into the group of workers returning to work, just as before.

This "war epidemic" affected a lot of people, not only patients, there are medical staff, there are ten million like Zhang Xian isolation workers to return to work. Further is the burden of life, step back is the bottom line of life. But Zhang Xian finally chose to believe: "The day will pass over the better, SARS is over, new pneumonia is no exception. "

(this article was written by Zhang Xian and others under pseudonyms)

-END-

- I'm a storyteller. -

/ / The Sun homebody on Ukulele. / / 

By Lin Lu, youth writer.
